note.p: French civil engineer and hydrologist. Studied the hydrology of the Paris basin and explained the landscape as the result of the movement of large bodies of water in the post-glacial period. Engineer responsible for navigation on the river Seine between Paris and Rouen, 1852–5. Worked for the department of water and drainage, Paris, from 1855; director, 1867. Inspector-general of roads and bridges, Paris, 1874. Member of the Académie des sciences, 1861.
